intro: Argyrolobium aequinoctiale, commonly known as the coastal flax or silver flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has silvery-green leaves with a fuzzy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy conditions. Argyrolobium aequinoctiale is a member of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing ability.
